solution.text:
Let the ratio be m : n
Now,
Using section formula as :
x = \({m\times _{{i+n}}_ + n\times _{i}_}\over {m + n} \) , y = \({m\times _{{j+n}}_ + n\times _{j}_}\over {m + n} \)
Here, x = _{{i+m}}_ and y = _{{j+m}}_
Therefore,
_{{i+m}}_ = \({m\times _{{i+n}}_ + n\times _{i}_}\over {m + n} \) and _{{j+m}}_ = \({m\times _{{j+n}}_ + n\times _{j}_}\over {m + n} \)
solving for x coordinate
i.e., _{{i+m}}_ = \({m\times _{{i+n}}_ + n\times _{i}_}\over {m + n}\)
i.e., _{{i+m}}_m + _{{i+m}}_n = _{{i+n}}_m + _{i}_n
i.e., - _{{i+m}}_m + _{{i+n}}_m = _{{i+m}}_n - _{i}_n
i.e., _{{n-m}}_m = _{m}_n
i.e., \( m\over n\) = \(_{m}_\over _{{n-m}}_\)
i.e., m : n = _{m}_ : _{{n-m}}_
Verifying that whether this ratio satisfies the y-coordinate also,
i.e., _{{j+m}}_ = \({m\times _{{j+n}}_ + n\times _{j}_}\over {m + n} \)
_{{j+m}}_ = \({{m\over n}\times _{{j+n}}_ + _{j}_}\over {{m\over n} + 1} \)
_{{j+m}}_ = \({{_{m}_\over _{{n-m}}_}\times _{{j+n}}_ + _{j}_}\over {{_{m}_\over _{{n-m}}_} + 1} \)
_{{j+m}}_ = \({{_{{m*(j+n)}}_\over _{{n-m}}_} + _{j}_}\over {{_{m}_\over _{{n-m}}_} + 1} \)
_{{j+m}}_ = \({{_{{m*(j+n)}}_} + _{{(n-m)*j}}_}\over {{_{m}_} + _{{n-m}}_} \)
_{{j+m}}_ = \(_{{(m*(j+n))+((n-m)*j)}}_\over _{{m+n-m}}_\)
_{{j+m}}_ = _{{j+m}}_

content.text: In what ratio does the point (_{{i+m}}_,_{{j+m}}_) divides the line segment joining the points P(_{i}_,_{j}_) and Q(_{{i+n}}_,_{{j+n}}_)?
